intro: Adenostemma scaevolifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often as a shrub or perennial herb. Its botanical features include a taproot system and the ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its pharmacological properties remain under study.
